string_table.name: npnxnanbnsnfns10111001101
string_table.string: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
Wdesk allows users to link text and numeric values across documents.
There are two links that you can create in Wdesk: Source Links and Destination Links.
First, a source link is the input point for one or more destination links.
A destination link is the output that will reflect changes made to the corresponding source link.

After completing this getting started lesson, you will be able to:

Link data from a workbook to a table cell in a document

Link data from a workbook to a presentation

Create in-text links

And

Format links

To create a destination link from a table or workbook cell:

click to select the cell, or span of cells, that you would like to serve as the source

right-click and select copy

select the cell where you would like the destination link to appear

right-click and select paste.

click on the clipboard icon that appears and select the radio button for Create Links From

you can mark the box labeled Default for future pastes

then, click the apply button to finish creating the source and destination link

Additional Create Link options in the clipboard include creating links from:

Only Cells With Values

All Cells

Only Cells with Links
For this activity you are going to link the value, 6.6%, from cell (I15) in the Workbook to cell (H11) in the Annual Report document. Then you will use the clipboard to set your linking options.
Ok, now you try it. Within the Workbook, click to select cell I15.
With cell I15 selected, right-click within the cell to display a list of menu options.
Select Copy from the list of menu options.

Within the Annual Report document, click within cell H11.

This will activate the document and select the cell.
Right-click within cell H11 to display a list of menu options.
Select Paste from the list of menu options.
Click the clipboard to select your linking options.
Select the Create Links From radio button.
You do have the option to carry over formatting from the table cell of the source link. For now, uncheck Apply Formatting.
Remember that you have the ability to save your link settings during your current working session. Check the box next to Set Default.
Click the Apply button to complete the linking process.

Notice that within the cell there is a green triangle with an orange underline in the upper left corner. Within the cell containing the source link there is a blue triangle with an orange underline. The orange underline lets you know that you need to share your changes. Click the Share button to share your changes.
The Share Document Changes window opens letting you know that you are about to share changes to the following document: Click the Share button to finish sharing your changes.

Data may also be linked between a workbook and a Presentation type document. For this exercise you will link the value from cell I-11 in the Workbook to the blue circle in the presentation.

Here we right-click on the 5.2% in cell I-11 and select Copy from the list of menu options then click the document tab to activate the Presentation.

Within the blue circle we place the cursor, right-click and select Paste.

Click the yellow clipboard to set your linking options.

Make sure that Create Links is selected then click Apply.

Now its your turn. For this activity you will take the source link from the workbook, that you created previously, and link it to the 6.6% in the dark gray circle.

Within the Workbook, click to activate cell I15.
With cell I15 activated, right-click to display a list of menu options.
Select Copy from the list of menu options.
Click the Monthly Financial Overview tab to activate the presentation document.
Within the dark gray circle, Double-click to select the 6.6%
Right-click on 6.6% to display a list of menu options.
Select Paste from the list of menu options.
Click the yellow clipboard, within the dark gray circle to open a menu of linking options.
Verify that Create Links is selected then click the green Apply button.
Now you will link the same value, 6.6%, from the workbook to another location within the presentation document. Within the Workbook, click to select cell I15.
Right-click the selected cell to display a list of menu options.
Select Copy from the list of menu options.
Activate the Monthly Financial Overview Presentation by clicking the document tab.
Activate the table by clicking anywhere within its boundaries.
Click to select the cell connecting the last column, % Increase (Decrease) to row 13.
Right-click within the selected cell to display a list of menu options.
Select Paste.
Click the yellow clipboard to open a menu of linking options.
Verify that Create Links From is selected then click Apply.

To create a source link in document text:

select the text that you want to serve as a source link

right-click and select Create Source Link

a visual cue will appear to indicate that the link has been created

To create a destination links from a source link in text:

Click on the source link to select it

Right-click and select Copy

Position your cursor where you would like to create the destination link - as either text in a document or in a table or workbook cell

Right-click, and select paste

A visual cue will appear to indicate that the destination link has been created

For this activity you are going to create an In-Text link from workbook cell I15 to the Operating Income section of the Annual Report. You will then use the yellow clipboard to set your linking options.
Now you give it a try. Within the Workbook, click to select cell I15.
Right-click within cell I15 to display a list of menu options.
Select Copy from the list of menu options.
Click the document tab to activate the Annual Report document.
Within the Operating Income section, double-click to select 6 percent.
Right-click to display a list of menu options.
Select Paste from the list of menu options.
Click the yellow clipboard to select your linking options.
Be sure that Create Links is selected then click the Apply button.

You can specify how you would like source and destination links to be displayed in Wdesk by modifying the link format.

To change how linked values are displayed:

click a link to select it

right-click, and select "Format Link"

use the drop-down menu to select from a list of formatting options

a preview of the selected format will display at the top of the dialog box

click Apply Formatting to confirm your changes
For this activity you are going to format an in-text link so that the value of the destination link displays according to your formatting options.
Now you do it. In the last activity you linked the 6.6% from the workbook to the operating income section of the Annual report. Click to highlight the 6.6%.
Right-click the selected value to display a list of menu options.
Select Format Link from the list of menu options.
Within the Format Link window click to open the category drop-down menu.
Within the Category dropdown menu select Text
Click Apply Formatting to apply your formatting changes.
The linked value now displays as 0.066 percent. Click the Share button to share your changes.
The Share Document Changes window opens letting you know that you are about to share changes to the following document: Click the Share button to finish sharing your changes.
